title: Covered Bridge
clue: The wooden crossing every skier knows
hints: The most iconic photo spot in Vail.
funFact: Vail's most popular proposal spot, decorated with thousands of twinkling lights in winter!

title: Chair Lift
clue: Where empty chairs hang high, waiting for riders
funFact: Vail has over 30 lifts serving 5,289 acres of skiable terrain!

title: The Gore Range
hints: You can see it from Jill's favorite store
funFact: The Gore Range extends for approximately 60 miles through the heart of Colorado!

title: Public Art / Sculpture
funFact: Vail has an extensive public art collection with over 40 permanent installations!

title: Water's Edge
clue: In the heart of the village, discover where water brings life and movement.
funFact: Gore Creek runs through the heart of Vail Village, providing a natural soundtrack to mountain life!

title: Skier
clue: Find a skier carrying their skis or mid-run.
funFact: Vail was founded in 1962 and has been a premier ski destination ever since!

title: Clock Tower
clue: A tower rises above the shops, keeping time at the center of it all.
funFact: The Clock Tower is one of Vail Village's most recognizable landmarks and meeting spots!

title: Berkshire Hathaway Office
clue: Where mountain life meets real estate — but only in Vail Village, not Lionshead.
funFact: This office has helped countless families find their dream homes in the Rocky Mountains!

title: On the Bus
funFact: Vail's free bus system makes it easy to explore the entire valley without a car!

title: Four-Legged Friends
clue: Vail is full of four-legged friends — find one and learn its name.
funFact: Vail is a dog-friendly town with many shops and restaurants welcoming furry companions!
